    • Fun I/O

    Fun I/O provides functional, high level abstractions for codecs, sources, sinks, stores, archives, filters, sockets et al. Fun I/O supports Java 8 or later and Scala 2.10, 2.11 and 2.12 equally well via dedicated APIs and is covered by the Apache License, version 2.0.

    Introduction

    Fun I/O composes the low level classes InputStream and OutputStream into powerful, high level abstractions like Codec, Source, Sink, Store, ArchiveStore, Socket, Filter et al. These abstractions are:

    • Easy to use and implement.
    • Stateless and therefore reusable and thread-safe by design (except for their observable side effects of course, e.g. writing data to a file).
    • Composable into stateless I/O subsystems.
    • Interoperable with any code which deals with an InputStream or OutputStream directly.

    Fun I/O takes proper care of resource management: All created InputStream and OutputStream instances are properly closed, even if there is an exception in a nested constructor. Say goodbye to resource leaks and try-with-resources statements!
